title: "VON WILLEBRAND DISEASE AND ANGIODYSPLASIA: THE ROLE OF VON WILLEBRAND FACTOR IN VESSEL FORMATION"
abstractText: Repair and formation of new blood vessels is a central process in health and disease. We propose that von willebrand factor, a blood protein made in the lining of blood vessels, plays an important role in regulating this process. Production of von willebrand factor is extremely variable in the population and thus may be an important contributor to disease. We have preliminary evidence that this can be observed and investigated using cells isolated from routine blood samples.
